intro: Ophiorrhiza sylvatica, commonly known as the forest mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It grows on the branches of host trees, primarily in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has small, opposite leaves and produces small white or yellowish flowers. Its fruits are berries that contain seeds dispersed by birds. Ophiorrhiza sylvatica plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its habitat by influencing host tree growth and supporting bird populations.
